com.engine.world

Class WorldHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engine.world.WorldHandler

  • public class WorldHandler
extends java.lang.Object

    WorldHandler

    WorldHandler is used to control the project's worlds. Whenever a World loads, its chunks are added to the list here. The those chunks are updated, rendered, and all around handled here.

    Author:
    Ryan Hochmuth

    • Method Detail

      • tickTiles

        public void tickTiles()
        Tick all of the Tiles within render distance. This method runs the Tiles' tick function to update position, check for collisions, etc.

      • renderTiles

        public void renderTiles(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Render all the Tiles within render distance. This method runs the Tiles' draw method to render it on screen.

      • getTileAtCoords

        public Tile getTileAtCoords(float xPos,
                            float yPos,
                            int section)
        Get a tile at the specified set of coordinates. Since there are three layers of chunks (background, mid-ground, and foreground) a section to search through must be specified. Background: 0 Mid-ground: 1 Foreground: 2
        Parameters:
        xPos - - the x position of the tile
        yPos - - the y position of the tile
        section - - the section of the world to search (background 0, mid-ground 1, foreground 2)
        Returns:
        Tile - the tile at those coordinates

      • getChunkWithTileAtCoords

        public Chunk getChunkWithTileAtCoords(float xPos,
                                      float yPos,
                                      int section)
        Get the chunk that contains the tile at the given set of coordinates. Since there are three layers of chunks (background, mid-ground, and foreground) a section to search through must be specified. Background: 0 Mid-ground: 1 Foreground: 2
        Parameters:
        xPos - - the x position of the tile
        yPos - - the y position of the tile
        section - - the section of the world to search (background 0, mid-ground 1, foreground 2)
        Returns:
        Chunk - the chunk that contains the tile at the given coordinates
